intro: Fimbristylis malaccana, commonly known as the Malacca sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its grass-like appearance, with slender, cylindrical stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear tiny, three-lobed flowers. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-poor soils. Fimbristylis malaccana is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in Southeast Asia.
